topics.body:
I'm in a slightly philosophical mood, so please forgive me for pontificating a bit. I think that true evil is the exploitation of human nature, whether good or ill. Murder, rape and robbery are all surely awful things that we must work to overcome, punish and care for the victims of, but they are simple, animal crimes. The legacy left by our ape ancestors.

True evil is either indulging in these things out of a desire to hurt, to destroy, to defile or looking at our nature and using it to hurt people. This is why I so loathe psychics, faith healers and the like and I don't think I've ever made my utter hate, my rage and contempt for these fucking parasites quite clear. They exploit grief, hope and desperation. Emotions that are not only human but uniquely vulnerable. To take those things and use them to hurt people...

Similarly to exploit the hind brain feelings, our fear, our hate, our rage strikes me as a uniquely vile act. We are creatures evolved to feel these things and in and of themselves they are not evil. Rage when we are truly wronged is a perfectly understandable reaction. Hate for that which is undoubtedly vile is perhaps even close to being righteous. Fear of immediate danger is goddamn sensible.

But to guide people to rage over slights that either did not happen or which were perpetrated by the long dead against the long dead, to tell people to hate that which is merely different, to teach fear of the outsider strikes me as wicked, and to do so knowingly as an act of definite and conscious evil. There can be no justification for such an act.

I apologize for rambling.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

At least they're not as bad as the top ten worst toys invented; if you're wondering how bad some toys are there is a actual video cheap plastic toy that you would normally find in a happy meal or such where the point of the game is to fly the planes into the world trade centers and you get more points the more you dodge anti-aircraft missiles and the more times you hit the buildings. . . No I'm not making this up either.

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542f8cb86368727f60ac0000#post_542f8cb86368727f60ac0000
When you think about it the reason why evil continues to exist in the world is that they continue to make themselves sound rational and logical.  To use a extreme example of what I mean is for ISIS they totally believe what they are doing is perfectly rational.

I'm not going to lie; I'm totally looking forward to how estimates predict 5 billion people are going to be using the web by 2020.  Why?  Cause the internet is ironically both the smartest and dumbest thing ever created.  It's going to be hilarious watching ISIS people on twitter trying to rationalize themselves and they already are on twitter and it's hilarious how badly they defend their actions in a open debate.

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542f8cb86368727f60ac0000#post_542f8cb86368727f60ac0000
I do what I can when I can.

I am of course human and therefor as limited and flawed as any other. There are times when I know, to my shame, that I have fallen for the same tricks and traps.

In my view the only ethical course is to speak out when you see these things, and I like to think that most of the time I'm able to live up to my own ideals.

To be clear I do not blame the victims of such trickery, and often even the perpetrators are just victims of previous abusers of human nature that took the terrible exploitation to heart.

That's the problem with a lot of problems, there is no one group or individual you can point to and blame for them because probably that person or group is just spouting the same terrible, evil things that they were taught by someone they had reason to believe.

This is also why I have a special, genuine hate for those who claim to speak to the dead or heal the sick through the power of God. These people have no excuse because they know, no matter how much they may lie to themselves, that they are frauds.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542f830063687251495c0000#post_542f830063687251495c0000
I can't say my beliefs are absolutely right nor can you say they are wrong. 

In my mind there has to be doubt or else there won't be any room for learning. Yet I am a believer for the sake of believing.

In the end it is comforting to know that there is light in the end of the tunnel. No matter how many times we fall. And I haven't lost my faith.

topics.body:
I know it's off topic, but still important to news:
I think there's a very good reason why the Hong Kong protests haven't been violently cracked down yet; cause everyone and their grandmas have phones now.  The difference between Tiananmen Square is that the second China sends in the military to crack down on the protests there's going to be every last person in the world watching it live and that's going to be extremely fucking ugly for china's international diplomacy.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

If China does become a democracy we're talking 5-10 years from now though.

"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542f922f63687218bc460000#post_542f922f63687218bc460000
I'm not talking about faith. That's your own damn business and as much as I may dislike religion I believe it is utterly ineradicable and perhaps even necessary to the peace of mind for some people.

I'm talking about people who exploit that faith. The people who say if you fill their collection plate God will heal your cancer and if it turns out he didn't then its your own damn fault for not having enough faith.
